content:
Determine the rhyme scheme for the following poem.

I see in the dark,
While others can't even spark,
A little light that'll do just right, 
So I can see what I like.
I see in the dark,
While others can't even spark,
A little light that'll do just right, 
So I can see what I like.
The rhyme scheme for the poem is AABB AABB. Each stanza follows the same pattern, with the first and second lines rhyming (dark/spark) and the third and fourth lines rhyming (right/like).
